Package io.github.waileong.fcm.config

Class FcmAutoConfiguration

java.lang.Object
io.github.waileong.fcm.config.FcmAutoConfiguration
@AutoConfiguration(after=org.springframework.boot.autoconfigure.task.TaskExecutionAutoConfiguration.class) @AutoConfigureOrder(-2147483648) @EnableConfigurationProperties(FcmProperties.class) @Import({FcmAuthenticationConfiguration.class,FcmConnectionConfiguration.class}) public class FcmAutoConfiguration extends Object
Provides automatic configuration for Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM) integration in Spring Boot applications. This class is responsible for setting up FCM-related beans, including service implementations and REST clients necessary for communicating with FCM services. It is designed to be autoconfigured after the TaskExecutionAutoConfiguration class and is given the highest precedence in autoconfiguration ordering to ensure that FCM services are available early in the application context.

The configuration reads FCM properties from application configuration files and initializes required FCM configuration classes. It also makes use of Spring's Import annotation to include FCM authentication and connection configurations, streamlining the setup process for FCM integration.

  • Method Details

    • fcmService

      @Bean public FcmServiceImpl fcmService(@Qualifier("fcmRestClient") org.springframework.web.client.RestClient fcmRestClient, @Qualifier("fcmJwtTokenPool") org.apache.commons.pool2.impl.GenericObjectPool<FcmJwtToken> googleFcmJwtTokenPool)
      Defines a bean for the FCM service implementation. This service is a central component for interacting with Firebase Cloud Messaging, providing a high-level API for sending messages and managing FCM interactions.

      The method injects a pre-configured RestClient that is tailored for FCM communication, ensuring that the service can perform HTTP requests to FCM with appropriate headers, error handling, and authentication.

      Parameters:
      fcmRestClient - The RestClient qualified for FCM, pre-configured with necessary settings for communication with Firebase Cloud Messaging services.
      Returns:
      An instance of FcmServiceImpl, ready to be used for FCM operations within the application.
